cons: There were no cons to this job

review_title: Underpaid, but good staff and training
pros:
The staff are excellent in the tutoring department.
There are plenty of resources available.
The experience is good, and the staff provide good references for future tutoring/teaching endeavors.
Flexible hours.
cons: Through some sort of legal mumbo-jumbo, they are able to pay student workers under minimum wage. While the experience and staff are good, I know many students who would have received better experience from a student job, opted to find better-paying jobs outside the school, in order to support their school bill.

review_title: Maranatha's work environment is very much like a family!
pros: I love the family-like work environment. The staff here are willing to help one another regardless of what the task is. The socialization process was very well done.
cons: Due to the fact that it is a university, there are some very busy times of the year while others can be extremely slow.

pros: Excellent benefits packages, very good colleagues, Summer vacation. the administration sometimes values opinions from employees. Faculty are offered a fair amount of independence in course setup. Help is available in improvement of teaching effectiveness.
cons: Confidence in job security is not always high. Employment is totally "at will" and can end at administrations will. The pay scale is below that of other institutions. many departments have a minimum number of faculty resulting in each faculty often having an assignment that includes many different courses and high number of classroom hours.

review_title: The “Board” which dictates everything at Maranatha is out of touch.
pros: Generally good, friendly people. Positive environment usually. Solid education, decent athletics program. Food used to be good, not as much lately.
cons: What are some of the challenges of working here? The board needs to be more in touch with the students and faculty / staff. Very judgmental environment.  The teachers other than Jeffrey Miller are great.

review_title: My experience on the Stage Crew was amazing. I recommend the job to any students looking for a fun environment to work.
job_title: Stage Crew Worker in Watertown, WI
pros: The pay was high on the Stage Crew. Co-workers are friendly and become your friends quickly. The performances are the highlight.
cons: The late nights practicing for the performances can get draining. It is a night job so homework had to be done prior to work.
